spec.vision: Deliver realistic celestial rendering and admin theme controls with high-quality textures, consistent lighting, and customizable theme presets
must: Add reusable texture, normal, and halo assets plus shading tweaks for planets, moons, and stars
Update rendering components to apply consistent lighting, rotation cues, and faint glow borders tied to theme colors
Extend admin editors to manage theme presets (planet type, lunar traits, star halo intensity) persisted through universe data services
Document art direction guidelines and workflow updates for configuring celestial themes
dont: Do not reposition celestial objects; limit changes to styling, shading, and metadata
Do not bloat bundle sizes or drop frame rates; enforce compression and asset reuse
nice: Support high-DPI/mobile devices with maintained performance
Provide texture import failure degradation with placeholder shading
Enable server-side rendering paths with lazily loaded materials
assumptions: Existing planets, moons, and stars look placeholder and lack customization
Large textures can bloat bundle sizes or drop frame rates if not compressed
Missing or legacy theme data will need fallback to default presets
